column4: hello all. Im using transmission to download files to a samba mount. My normal user can read/write fine to the mounted samba share....but transmission-daemon(the transmission user/group) has issues. Ive added my normal user to the transmission ground and ive added transmission to my normal users group. I then ran "chmod 770" on my mounted share...but for some reasons transmission keeps having issues.
im trying to find out the permissions i need to set for both my normal user and the transmission daemon can access them
yea
normal user can access all the files...but the debian-transmission cannot
well....thats not really ideal
as downloading torrents is just one use of the drive...my normal user should(and does) get priority access. i just need transmission to have access also
as long as the debian-transmission group has write access to the download folder, it should work..

it should. ive added my normal user(mike) to the debian-transmission group. and ive added the debian-transmission user to the mike group...i then chmod'ed the folder to 770...which seems to work for a little bit..but somehow it always gets unset.
are you specifying the create umask on the samba server(in the smb.conf)?
or are you using any options to mount the drive locally(like uid or gid in the fstab)?
ive set my create mask to 0770
can you also show me your mount line in fstab?
in /etc/transmission-daemon/settings.json i changed the umask value to "0" - cant remember exactly why, i know it was something with permissions
ah let me check mine.
hmm my umask in settings.json is 18 by default. im gonna try to make it 0.
